title: US Federal Holiday - New Year's Day
description: New Year's Day is the first day of the year in the Gregorian calendar.

title: US Federal Holiday - Martin Luther King Jr. Day
description: Birthday of Martin Luther King Jr., celebrated on the third Monday of January.

title: US Federal Holiday - Presidents' Day
description: Washington's Birthday, also known as Presidents' Day, is a federal holiday celebrated on the third Monday of February.

title: Islamic Holiday - Ramadan
description: Ramadan is the ninth month of the Islamic calendar, observed by Muslims worldwide as a month of fasting, prayer, reflection and community.

title: Jewish Holiday - Passover
description: Passover is a major Jewish holiday that celebrates the exodus of the Israelites from slavery in Egypt.

title: US Federal Holiday - Memorial Day
description: Memorial Day is a federal holiday in the United States for remembering and honoring persons who have died while serving in the United States Armed Forces.

title: US Federal Holiday - Independence Day
description: Independence Day, also called the Fourth of July, is a federal holiday commemorating the adoption of the Declaration of Independence on July 4, 1776.

title: US Federal Holiday - Labor Day
description: Labor Day is a federal holiday in the United States celebrated on the first Monday in September to honor and recognize the American labor movement.

title: Jewish Holiday - Rosh Hashanah
description: Rosh Hashanah is the Jewish New Year. It's a two-day celebration that begins on the first day of Tishrei, the seventh month of the Jewish calendar.

title: Hindu Holiday - Diwali
description: Diwali is the Hindu festival of lights, usually lasting five days and celebrated during the Hindu lunisolar month Kartika.

title: US Federal Holiday - Thanksgiving Day
description: Thanksgiving Day is a national holiday in the United States, celebrated on the fourth Thursday of November.

title: Jewish Holiday - Hanukkah
description: Hanukkah is a Jewish festival commemorating the rededication of the Second Temple in Jerusalem. It is also known as the Festival of Lights.

title: Christian Holiday - Christmas Day
description: Christmas Day is an annual festival commemorating the birth of Jesus Christ, observed primarily on December 25 as a religious and cultural celebration.
